meanings.definition: The quality or state of being acid.
meanings.sent1: The acidity of the lemon made my mouth pucker.
meanings.sent2: The acidity of vinegar can be overpowering if used in excess.
meanings.sent3: The acidity of the tomato sauce was so strong, it could almost talk back!
meanings.sent4: The acidity of her words cut through the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The acidity of the pineapple juice was like a burst of sunshine in my mouth.

meanings.definition: The amount of acid present in a substance.
meanings.sent1: The acidity of the soil affected the growth of the plants.
meanings.sent2: The acidity of the battery determined its power output.
meanings.sent3: The acidity of the lemonade was so high, it could power a small car!
meanings.sent4: The acidity of his tone hinted at his frustration.
meanings.sent5: The acidity of the vinegar was so strong, it could dissolve metal.

meanings.sent1: The acidity of the green apple made my mouth water.
meanings.sent2: The acidity of the yogurt gave it a refreshing tang.
meanings.sent3: The acidity of the orange juice was so intense, it could wake up the dead!
meanings.sent4: The acidity of her wit was unmatched in the room.
meanings.sent5: The acidity of the pickles was so sharp, it made my eyes water.
